column4: Hello, when I try to start the apache2 daemon I get this error: "apache2: bad user name www-data". Help, please?
did you delete the www-data user from your system?
I have no idea what went wrong, it was working previously
you should try doing `sudo dpkg-reconfigure apache2`...
i think that's the right command.  basically what that's saying is the www-data user doesn't exist, but it should've been created during install of apache.
worst case you can add the user yourself then `chown -R www-data` on your web directory
Yes, but it prompts me for a password and other stuff, so I don't know what Apache expects me to give it
yeah, that's why i recommend the dpkg-reconfigure option.  not sure if the package is "apache2" or something else
I just did the reconfigure command... It returned nothing and it didn't fix the problem
try it with apache2.2-common instead of apache2
Lol. james@james-ubuntu:/home$ sudo dpkg-reconfigure apache2.2-common returns: chown: `www-data': invalid user
I might just end up having to do a sudo dpkg --purge apache2 and rewrite my httpd.conf
back up your conf before you undelete it
on feisty my www-data user is #33
Thanks for the tip, I backed up my conf files already. I'm just gonna blast away apache and remake everything though. :P
Oh puh-LEEZE. After purging it through dpkg and then reinstalling it I still get an error where it expects the user to exist. I guess I can try blasting the common files too.
